questions.question: This Marvel character, known for his adamantium claws, was originally depicted with bone claws in his first comic appearance.
questions.fact_source: In Wolverine's first full appearance in 'The Incredible Hulk' #181 (1974), his claws were depicted as part of his gloves, and it wasn't until later that they were retconned to be part of his anatomy.

questions.question: Before becoming the Sorcerer Supreme, this character was a renowned neurosurgeon who lost the use of his hands in a car accident.
questions.fact_source: Doctor Strange's origin story, as depicted in 'Strange Tales' #115 (1963), involves him seeking a cure for his injured hands, leading him to become a master of the mystic arts.

questions.question: This superhero team was originally introduced as a group of teenage mutants trained to protect a world that fears and hates them.
questions.fact_source: The X-Men debuted in 'The X-Men' #1 (1963) as a team of young mutants led by Professor Charles Xavier, aiming to promote peaceful coexistence between humans and mutants.

questions.question: This character, who later becomes a prominent member of the Avengers, was initially a villain known as the 'Crimson Cowl.'
questions.fact_source: In 'The Avengers' #57 (1968), Vision is introduced as a creation of Ultron, originally intended to destroy the Avengers before turning against his creator.

questions.question: This Marvel antihero, known for his brutal methods, was first introduced as a villain in 'The Amazing Spider-Man' comics.
questions.fact_source: The Punisher made his first appearance in 'The Amazing Spider-Man' #129 (1974) as an antagonist hired to eliminate Spider-Man.

categories.category: Behind the Scenes of the MCU

questions.question: This actor was initially cast as Bruce Banner in 'The Incredible Hulk' (2008) before being replaced by Mark Ruffalo in subsequent MCU films.
questions.fact_source: Edward Norton portrayed Bruce Banner in 'The Incredible Hulk' (2008), but due to creative differences, Mark Ruffalo took over the role starting with 'The Avengers' (2012).

questions.question: This director, known for his work on 'Buffy the Vampire Slayer,' directed the first two 'Avengers' films in the MCU.
questions.fact_source: Joss Whedon directed 'The Avengers' (2012) and 'Avengers: Age of Ultron' (2015), bringing together the ensemble cast of superheroes.

questions.question: This actor, famous for his role in 'Pulp Fiction,' portrays the director of S.H.I.E.L.D. in the MCU.
questions.fact_source: Samuel L. Jackson plays Nick Fury, the director of S.H.I.E.L.D., appearing in multiple MCU films starting with a cameo in 'Iron Man' (2008).

questions.question: This actress, known for her role in 'Lost in Translation,' portrays a former Russian spy and member of the Avengers.
questions.fact_source: Scarlett Johansson plays Natasha Romanoff, also known as Black Widow, debuting in 'Iron Man 2' (2010) and appearing in several subsequent MCU films.

questions.question: This actor, who portrayed a Marvel superhero, was considered for the role of Doctor Doom in the 2005 'Fantastic Four' film before being cast as a different character in the MCU.
questions.fact_source: Before being cast as Tony Stark/Iron Man, Robert Downey Jr. was considered for the role of Doctor Doom in the 2005 'Fantastic Four' film. [Source: https://people.com/robert-downey-jr-almost-played-doctor-doom-before-iron-man-8685481]

questions.question: In the MCU, this character's variant from another universe is portrayed by the same actor but with a different superhero identity.
questions.fact_source: In 'Spider-Man: No Way Home' (2021), variants of Peter Parker from different universes are portrayed by actors from previous Spider-Man film franchises.

questions.question: This animated MCU series explores alternate realities, showcasing how events might have unfolded differently in the Marvel Universe.
questions.fact_source: 'What If...?' is an animated series that premiered on Disney+ in 2021, exploring alternate scenarios in the Marvel Universe.

questions.question: In 'Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness' (2022), this character is introduced as the daughter of a superhero from an alternate universe.
questions.fact_source: America Chavez, portrayed by Xochitl Gomez, is introduced in 'Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness' (2022) as a teenager with the ability to travel between universes.

questions.question: This Marvel film features a crossover of characters from different film franchises, including the X-Men and Fantastic Four.
questions.fact_source: 'Deadpool & Wolverine' (2024) features multiple superhero cameos from various universes within the Marvel collection. [Source: https://time.com/7001886/deadpool-and-wolverine-cameos/]

questions.question: In the MCU, this character's variant becomes the Sorcerer Supreme in an alternate universe.
questions.fact_source: In the Disney+ series 'Loki' (2021), alternate versions of Loki are introduced, including one who becomes the Sorcerer Supreme.
